Generation I.Red: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
Generation I.Yellow: An agile Pok é mon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
Generation I.Stadium: Quick to anger, it will begin brawling on the slightest provocation. It is unsafe to approach as it is very nimble.

Generation II.Gold: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
Generation II.Silver: It's unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can't distinguish friends from foes.
Generation II.Crystal: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It's unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can't distinguish friends from foes. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
Generation III.Sapphire: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
Generation III.Emerald: When it starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign of anger. However, since this happens instantly, there is no time to flee.
Generation III.FireRed: Light and agile on its feet, and ferocious in temperament. When angered, it flies into an uncontrollable frenzy.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

Generation IV.Diamond: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation IV.Pearl: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation IV.Platinum: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It's unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can't distinguish friends from foes.

Generation V.Black: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation V.White: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation V.Black 2: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation V.White 2: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

Generation VI.X: It's unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can't distinguish friends from foes.
Generation VI.Y: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.

Generation VII.Sun: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
Generation VII.Moon: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn't hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in treetop colonies. If one member of the group becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It lives in treetop colonies. If one member of the group becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
Generation IX.Violet: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

Generation V.Black 2: Trade with Curtis in Nimbasa City (female player character only)
Generation V.White 2: Trade with Curtis in Nimbasa City (female player character only)

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Routes 225 and 226 ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Routes 225 and 226 ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Area One , Area Five West Province: Area One Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area One , Area Five West Province: Area One Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Kitakami Road , Apple Hills , Oni Mountain , Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens , Kitakami Wilds , Timeless Woods
